item.description:
Hi Everyone,

WEATHER
Today: Mostly sunny, with a high near 84. West wind between 5 and 10 mph.

Tonight: A chance of rain, mainly after 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 66. Southwest wind between 6 and 9 mph becoming calm. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

Sat...SW winds 5 to 10 kt. Seas 1 ft or less.

For the latest update on weather:
http://www.usairnet.c...


ALSO IF THERE LOOKS LIKE THE POSSIBILITY OF ANY RAIN ON THE WAY TO 7 FALLS, WE ALWAYS HAVE THE OPTION TO DIVERT TO HURD AND HAVE THE BARBIE-Q AND FIRE THERE..i am opting to do this instead just in case.

11:30 am at the site was chosen to avoid traffic in Middletown etc.
Paddling by 12:00 noon.

High Tide on the shoreline at 11.

I am proposing right after the put in spot to take a left up the first water channel then going up the Blackhall river to its source since its High tide at 11 am and we wont be stuck in the mud pits on either direction, and enjoy a faster return current flow to GI on return (i want most of you to gain a bit more endurance for the later Lou Tennant River and other events) then doing some actual self rescue practice on Great Island till its time for the Barbie-Q and the Refeshing Bath water of 7 Falls with a nice fireside Pot Luck Barbie-q into the night !!!

We may not have the famous ZIPPER action on the island we all like- but lets see.

Tides for Saybrook Jetty starting with June 26, 2010.

Day High Tide Height Sunrise Moon Time % Moon
/Low Time Feet Sunset Visible

Sa 26 Low 5:03 AM 0.1 5:18 AM Set 5:14 AM 99
26 High 11:06 AM 3.4 8:26 PM Rise 8:48 PM
26 Low 5:04 PM 0.7
26 High 11:23 PM 4.4


Ok this is an area that is good for both recreational and sea kayakers to enjoy a tidal river and some interesting ocean action.

Location for the Put In:
GPS, Mapquest and others, use 415 Smith Neck Road, Old Lyme CT to get you close enough.


From Hartford:
Take I- 91 South to Exit 22 S for rte 9
Take rte 9 all the way to I-95 NORTH
Cross the CT River bridge to the first exit --- Exit # 70.
At the end of the exit ramp, turn RIGHT onto Route 156/Shore Road and continue 1.7 miles.
Turn RIGHT onto Smith Neck Road, ( Be cautious, there is a yellow diamond sign that partially blocks the street name view till almost right at the street) and proceed .7 miles (to its end) there will be a big parking lot and drop off area by the water..

------------------------------------

Bring the sunscreen, hats, gloves (if you need perfect looking hands for work) or for blister free paddling, and whatever else you need for the outside.
Don't wear cotton to avoid being wet or cold if you get wet. SOME OF YOU WILL GET WET
----------------------------------

Bring some POT LUCK food..and your favourite beverages for the group Barbie-q after.
Bring what you really like and some more. We might like it and will eat it even if its a doubble with someone else.

The Group Pot Luck barbie-q is the second half to a PERFECT outing also right by the river after the paddle...(if you didnt get a chance to paddle with us this is also open to people interested in meeting us

...Bring chairs..and whatever else you like to sit around on.
The grill is loaded and ready, BRING SOME SCRAP WOOD TOO.

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Kayaks available:

A Paddle & Paddle Leash, Life Jacket with whistle is included with any of my yaks.

Doughnation of $ 20.00, bucks for my kayaks reserved for this particular event.
Its way less than what sport shops charge and the yaks & Paddles are top quality delivered and picked up at the site etc..

Please make sure you are familiar with the yak you choose and can fit in them since i don't have any "Wide Butt" (greater than 17"~18" butts) yaks anymore.
Don't laugh, its serious, some will not fit in a yak thats too small (ie the Greenlander Pro) of an opening and i will feel sad you cant go..etc..the other option is to maybe trade with someone..etc ..if you need to.
This has worked in the past very well.

I will only bring the yaks that are confirmed by a yes and by persons i have some familiarity with ?..(ie paddle skills matched to the boat, etc.)

Maybee's obviously can't reserve any yaks & if ya reserve one and don't show up, ya won't ever get a second chance to again unless its some real good excuse..

Sorry i don't like to leave un-attended yaks on the trailer. They get stolen too easily.


IF USING MY YAKS YOU CANT LOOK LIKE A BONEHEADED BEGINNER AND STEP INTO THEM VIA THE FLOOR (yes the lightest kayaks have thin fiberglass and your feet will go through them) OR DRIVE UP ON SHORE WITH THEM LIKE YOU ARE GOING TO A DRIVE IN MOVIE. ( In an 18 foot long boat you will still be 10 or so feet out in the water at a greater depth.) Only Novices in short wide cheap plastic boats do that kind of thing. :-)~

READ THE INFO ON THE FOLLOWING LINK: I will also show you the correct way and you will look like a intelligent seasoned pro and impress the others who don't know how. Then you may laugh at the ones that fall in on entry and exit who don't know how.
http://www.ehow.com/h...
Hint: Always enter and exit while being parallel to shore.
-----------------
Please review the links below for the equipment specifications to be at least familiar with which boat or equipment you would be best suited for.

Cheap LIfe Jackets with a whistle is all i have for most of you since a GOOD QUALITY LIFE JACKET should be chosen for your particular body shapes , paddling style, and fit adjusted...if you have your own please bring it..
----------------------
I only have one "GOOD" life jacket for someone that can fit in it.
Its a Medium Kokatat* Ladies MsFit Tour: (this is also purchased by guys since it has a great fit and versatility) Its really too small for me...but i like the way it works.

http://www.rei.com/pr...

------------------
All my yaks come with Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths (220-230) and types (strait, or ergonomic bent, small and normal shaft dia's.) of the same version are in the bucket.
You choose your preference.

http://www.wernerpadd...

(No ya cant use these paddles for paddle float entry practice. i have some cheap metal ones for that.)-
------------------

Also for comfort is my favourite Yak Pad's optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere..

http://www.yakpads.co...

-----------------

BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access:

http://www.kayakprosh...

------------------

Eddyline Wind Dancer, Red, Rudder Equipped.
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with Novice and up skills.

http://www.epinions.c...

highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable Sea kayak, 18'=
-------> ---RESERVED FOR MELODY
---

---------------------

NDK Greenlander Pro, Red, Skeg Equipped.
Medium sized paddler (120-175 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced skills.
Note: This kayak is limited to a Maximum Butt width of apx 12-13 inches because of the installed hip braces.

http://www.atlanticka...

Fast Greenland style Sea kayak, moderated stability, 18'= -----> ---AL-R ?? or someone else interested in this kind of yak ??--.

---------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the medium sized kayak of the Eliza series.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (42 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"= -----> ---RESERVED FOR MARY--

----------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (Modified), Yellow, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the lightest and has the smallest cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"= ------> --RESERVED FOR TRICE --

---------------------

Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the heaviest model (50 lbs) and larger cockpit of the Eliza series.
(To be Hopefully replaced with another Gullimot Cedar Strip Night Heron next year)
So try this one before you buy if interested.

http://www.neckykayak...

stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (50 LB) ladies kayak, 15'3.5"= --E----> --RESERVED FOR KAREN M.--

-------------------

Guillemot Cedar Strip Night Heron.

(Greenland Paddle available also if desired for the authentic Greenland look and feel)

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with beginner/intermediate and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-...

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (45 lbs), 18' =
------> ---RESERVED FOR JOSEPHINE --

------------------

see ya all there..
al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the ORANGE STRIPED TRAFFIC CONES

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: *BLACKHALL RIV & GILLIGANS Island* Rec/Sea Kayaking & Pot Luck Barbie-Q @ HURD
